com.sana.android.plugin.data.event

Class BytePushingDataEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sana.android.plugin.data.event.BaseDataEvent
      • com.sana.android.plugin.data.event.BytePushingDataEvent

  • public class BytePushingDataEvent
extends BaseDataEvent
    Created by hanlin on 9/13/14. This event is actively triggered by sensors when the sensor pushes data to the app. Therefore we don't need to have complicated routines. It will get notified when data is available and read whatever available in the input stream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BytePushingDataEvent

        public BytePushingDataEvent(java.lang.Object sender,
                            java.io.InputStream incomingData,
                            int packetSize)
        Create an instance of the event with a given packet size.
        Parameters:
        sender -
        incomingData -
        packetSize - The size of data packet to expect. Be cautious while setting this parameter. The event will always try to obtain the specified number of bytes from the input stream. If fewer bytes are available in the stream, it will block.

    • Method Detail

      • bytesAvailable

        public int bytesAvailable()
        Tells the event there is available data to be read. The event will determine the number of bytes it needs to read and proceed on reading them. After the event is done reading the bytes, it will return the number of bytes read.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read. -1 if the stream is closed or when there were errors while reading.

        public void startEvent()

               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
